parts.name: Introduction
parts.text:
Welcome to {{italic::Bohrok Invasion}}, a campaign utilizing the card pool of the Bionicle YGOPro Expansion.
(Check out bye-project.xyz for further information!)

In the role of either the Toa or the Bohrok Swarms, the players will face off over the fate of the island of Mata Nui.
First, choose which side to take.
(Both players can technically make the same choice, but be aware the lore won't make any sense if you do.)

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: The defeat of Makuta at the hands of the Toa was supposed to bring an end to the dark times on Mata Nui ...
But with the sudden appearance of the Bohrok swarms pouring out from their nests deep beneath the ground, the island faces greater danger than ever.
To combat this new threat, the Toa have once more gathered at Kini-Nui.

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: The beacon has been received. The time of awakening draws close. Now, Mata Nui must be made as it was in the Before-Time.
Huh? Me? You don't remember me from the chronicles?
Of course not. I wrote at least some of those, and I don't unduly toot my own horn, unlike A CERTAIN COLLEAGUE OF MINE WHO ACTS LIKE HE'S THE PROTAGONIST AND -
Ahem. Where was I? Yes, let us take a look at the preparations taking place in the Bohrok Nests.

parts.name: Tahu
parts.text: Just what are these Bohrok? They advance spreading nothing but mindless destruction, but they do so using the same powers of the elements that we wield.

parts.name: Turaga Vakama
parts.text: They are a force as ancient as Mata Nui itself, known even to us only through visions and through chronicles of times long past.
Why they are able to control the elements just as you do, I cannot tell, but do not forget: There are other powers that only you Toa are able to use.
You mean ...?
Indeed. The Great Kanohi Masks which you have so dilligently gathered may just become the key to victory in this battle.

onupo.mdesc: Recruit(?) a swarm of little helpers

parts.name: Pohatu
parts.text: Whoa there!

parts.name: Pohatu
parts.text: Talk about a chance meeting. How are things looking down below?

parts.name: Onua
parts.text: Not much better than on the surface, I'm afraid. Fortifying the tunnels has held the swarms at bay, but with their numbers and persistence, they will break through before long.
Though I doubt they'll have an easy time. I've noticed we're not the only residents of this island standing in their way.
What do you -

parts.name: Kofo-Jaga
parts.text: HISSSSSS
Oh.

toaKaita.mdesc: Unite the forces of the Toa

parts.name: Gali
parts.text: Divided, these swarms will overrun us. Now is the time to unite our powers.

parts.name: lewa
parts.text: Wise-truth, sister. As they work in perfect coordination, so must we.

parts.name: Kopaka
parts.text: ... If that is what it takes.

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: With their allies assembled and strategy clear, the Toa head out to confront the rampaging swarms.
This is but one of many battles to protect the island of Mata Nui.

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: Despite some success in combating the swarm, their tireless advance showed no signs of ceasing.
In an effort to turn the tables, the islanders began devising new tactics.

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: Direct combat against the overwhelming masses of the Bohrok could slow, but ultimately not halt their destructive march.
In an effort to turn the tables, the islanders began devising new tactics.

gahdok.mdesc: Bahrag Gahdok: Bolster the main swarms

parts.name: Bahrag Gahdok, Queen of the Bohrok
parts.text: We must continue deploying more Bohrok, until all is clean.
Clean it all. It must be cleaned.

krana.mdesc: Krana: More brain for your brawn

parts.text: Clean ... it ... all ...
... it must be cleaned ...

cahdok.mdesc: Bahrag Cahdok: Acquire additional support from Bohrok Va

parts.name: Bahrag Cahdok, Queen of the Bohrok
parts.text: The swarms are in motion. Bohrok Va, be sure to keep up logistical support.
Clean it all. It must be cleaned.

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: As the swarms head out to cleanse the surface, it appears they have met with some resistance.
However, the goal is clear. We shall not be stopped from doing our duty.

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: Good progress is being made, despite some who would seek to stand in our way.
Now is the time to redouble our efforts and truly clean it all.

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: While some of our advances are facing losses, progress is being made across the island, step by step.
Now is the time to redouble our efforts and truly clean it all.

parts.name: Nuparu, Matoran Engineer
parts.text: Toa! How goes the battle against the swarms?
We Matoran are also doing all we can. Here, have a look at the latest in anti-Bohrok technology.

exoToa.mdesc: Exo-Toa: The secret hidden in the Bohrok Nests

parts.name: Tahu
parts.text: So we have made it at last. The nests of the Bohrok, deep within Mata Nui itself. Time to end this once and for all.

parts.name: Kopaka
parts.text: Look, Tahu. These carvings in the floor. They match the Krana we have collected. This must be where they are meant to go.
And just what will we find if we place them here?

parts.name: Lewa
parts.text: Armor ... but more than armor ...

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: With the support of the islanders and their own unyielding efforts, the Toa continued to defend Mata Nui.
But merely fighting on the surface was not going to bring an end to the threat. The time had come to dive deep into the nests of the Bohrok and strike at their commanding Queens.

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: In the depths of the Bohrok Nest, the Toa at last vanquished the Bahrag. And on the surface, the swarms fell silent.
The threat seemed over, but a new darkness already loomed on the horizon. And the Toa, too, found themselves changed forever ...

parts.name: Takua, the Chronicler
parts.text: Despite being outmatched in their battle against the Bahrag, the Toa eventually succeeded in sealing away the Queens by combining their powers, bringing the advance of the Bohrok to a halt.
The threat seemed over, but a new darkness already loomed on the horizon. And the Toa, too, found themselves changed forever ...

bahrag.mdesc: The Bahrag: Prepare for a final showdown

parts.name: Bahrag Gahdok, Queen of the Bohrok
parts.text: They draw near.

parts.name: Bahrag cahdok, Queen of the Bohrok
parts.text: They who do not belong.
They who dare challenge us.
They who will be removed.

parts.name: Squad Commander Tahnok
parts.text: UNEXPECTED OBSTACLE DETECTED. ACTIVATING KAITA PROCEDURE.

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: Using the Krana they had collected as a key, our enemies advanced deep into the nest and challenged the Bahrag themselves.
Should they win, the swarms would cease their operations. But should they be defeated, nothing would remain to stand in the way of our mission.
Thus began the decisive battle.

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: The might of our Queens drove the intruders to the brink of destruction, but tragedy struck all the same - an impenetrable seal, formed from the union of six elemental powers.
With the Bahrag thus incapacitated, the swarms have stopped their operations. But at the same time, something else has been unleashed ...

parts.name: Gearhead Bohrok, the Royal Herald
parts.text: And thus, in the final battle, the Queens were defeated, trapped behind an impenetrable seal of Protodermis.
With the Bahrag thus incapacitated, the swarms have stopped their operations. But at the same time, something else has been unleashed ...

parts.name: Gali Nuva
parts.text: Kopaka ... What has happened? What have we become?

parts.name: Kopaka Nuva
parts.text: More than we were. More than anyone has ever been.

parts.name: Onua Nuva
parts.text: Those chambers were filled with Protodermis! It changed us - increased our power ...

parts.name: Tahu Nuva
parts.text: Let us worry about why it happened later. There are more important things to do.

parts.name: Pohatu Nuva
parts.text: Uh, what are those ... things up ahead?

parts.name: Nuhvok-Kal
parts.text: We are the Bohrok-Kal. We search for Cahdok and Gahdok, Queens of the Swarms.

parts.name: Pahrak-Kal
parts.text: Tell us where you have hidden the Bahrag, and then stand aside. We have no wish to harm helpless foes.

parts.name: Lewa Nuva
parts.text: Helpless? Toa Nuva are never helpless! We'll run you into the ground!
BAHRAG INTEGRITY CHECK NEGATIVE
INITIATING RECOVERY PROTOCOL
COMMENCE KALIFORNICATION
A brief overview on the key features of the Toa Mata archetype.

All six main monsters are Level 6 Warriors spread over the FIRE, WATER, EARTH, and WIND Attributes. Despite their Level, they can be Normal Summoned even on an empty field, by Tributing another monster in your hand that either matches in Attribute or is also a Toa Mata.

On the field, aside from decently big stat lines, they offer various useful effects that trigger when certain events occur. Having the right Toa on scene at the right moments is crucial to move the duel in your favor.

You can also equip the Toa with their Kanohi, the masks of power that grant them protection and other boosts. Equipping a new Kanohi will destroy any mask already equipped, but this can be to your advantage, as each of them will search out the Toa Mata it belongs to upon hitting the GY.

Further support includes the Suva, which lets you swap Kanohi as a Quick Effect, and the Suva Kaita, which provides a way to bring back Toa from GY and banishment. Both are Level 1 Rock monsters that count as multiple Attributes in your hand, making them perfect Tribute fodder for the Toa Mata!
Several Spells and Traps depicting the arrival and adventures of the Toa can also help you find your way to these monsters and put them on the field more quickly.

Finally, your special Boon "Heroes Assembled" is a Spell you can activate from the Extra Deck while only your opponent controls a monster. By revealing a Toa or a Kanohi you already have, it lets you adjust your hand with additional pieces from your Deck or banishment. You only get one, so use it wisely!
That concludes this tutorial. Happy deckbuilding and dueling, and good luck!
A brief overview on the key features of the Bohrok archetype.

The core of the swarm are these six Level 4 Machines. Each of them has two similar effects:
- A Flip effect that Special Summons a different name from your Deck in face-down Defense Position.
- A unique removal effect at the cost of returning itself to the Deck, either immediately or during the End Phase depending on the effect.
Your basic goal is to eat through your opponent's resources with a neverending onslaught of these monsters. If you wake one, you wake them all.

The Krana are the brains of the swarm, which you can use from your hand to grant the Bohrok special additional powers. In addition, some Krana let you Special Summon a Bohrok directly from your Deck to wield it, while others can be banished from the GY to take control of monsters destroyed by your Bohrok.
(Note: To save you some reading, only 4 of 8 Krana Types are included in this campaign. Check the project homepage to find out what the others do!)

The supporting Bohrok Va are Level 2 Tuner monsters that can each be Special Summoned from your hand if you control a matching Bohrok, providing different utility effects on the field. In the End Phase after being sent to the GY, they also help you recycle either Bohrok in your GY or Krana you have previously banished.

Your special Boon "Queen's Gambit" secures your setup by retaliating against attempts to remove the swarms from your field - either banishing a card or searching for some backup. If you additionally Tribute a monster, you can even do both of these things, or keep the Boon around to defend against another attack on a future turn!
That concludes this tutorial. Happy deckbuilding and dueling, and good luck!

faction.title: Which role will you play in this campaign?

list.name: Toa
list.desc:
Defend Mata Nui against the threat of the Bohrok Swarms!

Powerful Warrior monsters with a wide range of build options - use multi-card combos for explosive plays that overwhelm your opponent's defenses.

list.name: Bohrok
list.desc:
Clean it all. It must be cleaned.

Straightforward, consistent engine of Flip Monsters that natively provide swarming, removal, and recycling - slow to get going, but highly resilient once in motion.

toaSpecial.mdesc: A special trick to combat the Bohrok?

bohrokSpecial.mdesc: A special trick to combat the Toa?

trades.Bohrok Va Kaita Za: Bahrag Gahdok, Queen of the Bohrok

trades.Bohrok Va Kaita Ja: Bahrag Cahdok, Queen of the Bohrok

toaWin.title: Congratulations! You have halted the invasion of the Bohrok!

bohrokWin.title: Congratulations! Mata Nui shall be As It Was in the Before-Time!

toaLose.title: You were unable to stop the Bohrok Invasion ...

bohrokLose.title: The island of Mata Nui will not be cleaned this day ...
